Thermostat App

UX / UI / OPOWER

About the project

The Opower thermostat app is a way for home owners to control their energy use from anywhere, any time, using their mobile device. My team was tasked with designing a new experience for users to control and set their ideal temperature schedules.

My role

I worked with a small team of developers and designers on a tight release schedule. Some of my responsibilities included wireframing, user testing, prototyping and Interface animation.

Read the Case Study

More control over home confort.

A new API for our connected thermostat enabled users to set a more flexible home temperature schedule. This new paradigm required a redesign of two important features of the application.

With limited developement resources we created a fresh new experience that could be seamlessly integrated into the existing design.

Designing for behavior change

For this project I had to not only create a great user experience but also encourage users to reduce their energy consumption.

We acheived this by making efficient actions easy and providing users with positive feedback when they are saving energy.

The sky was not the limit

Instead of designing from the ground up, I had to figure out ways to create a fresh new experience that aligned with the pre-exiting interaction model.

Basically, our solution couldnâ€™t break anything that would require additional developement resources.

Data Driven Insights

Analyzing data about how people use the app helped us to discover usuability issues which then led to design insights

Rapid User Testing

For each round of user testing I created two medium fidelity click-through prototypes that could be displayed on mobile devices. I then used a task-based test to discovery any usability issues.

By creating two different tests I was able to quickly explore multiple design directions at once.

Interface Animations

As part of the final deliverables I created a series of animated gifs to show the developement team how it should look and feel.
